table.name: action
table.remarks: Represents a concrete action recorded by the case management system. All actions have an actor and the date/time they occurred.

column.name: action_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for the action. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: case_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: action_type_action_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a relationship between case management actions and logical types. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: actor_guid
column.remarks: Represents the IDIR guid of the user who performed the action.

column.name: action_date
column.remarks: The date the action was recorded. This value is user entered.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the action is active and should be displayed in the application.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: equipment_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a piece of equipment. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

table.name: action_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible actions that can be performed on a case.

column.name: action_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a case management action.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management action.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management action.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management action is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management action.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management action was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management action.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management action was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: action_h
table.remarks: History table for action table

column.name: h_action_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for action history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the action that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the action table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the action table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: action_type_action_xref
table.remarks: Contains the relationship between case management actions and logical types.

column.name: action_type_action_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a relationship between case management actions and logical types. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: action_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a logical grouping of case management actions.

column.name: action_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a case management action.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the case management actions should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the relationship between case management actions and logical types is active.

table.name: action_type_code
table.remarks: Case management actions are grouped into logical types. For example COMPASSESS = 'Complaint Assessment'.

column.name: action_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a logical grouping of case management actions.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a logical grouping of case management actions.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a logical grouping of case management actions.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the logical grouping of case management actions is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the action type entry.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the action type entry was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the action type entry.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the action type entry was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: age_code
table.remarks: Used to categorize wildlife into age brackets. For example ADLT = "Adult"

column.name: age_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an age type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of an age type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of an age type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the age type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if an age type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the age type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the age type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the age type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the age type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: agency_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all the organizations that have been onboarded onto the Case Management System. This can be used to restrict some content to organization specific values.

column.name: agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the agency code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the agency code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the agency code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the agency code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the agency was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the agency code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the agency was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: authorization_permit
table.remarks: Contains the authroized site id for the Authroization Outcome

column.name: authorization_permit_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an authorized_permit record

column.name: case_file_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: authorization_permit_id
column.remarks: The value used for an authorized site id

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the has been soft deleted.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the authroized site id.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the authroized site id was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the authroized site id

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the authroized site id was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: authorization_permit_h
table.remarks: History table for authorization_permit table

column.name: h_authorization_permit_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for authorization permit history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the authorization permit that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the authorization permit table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the authorization permit table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: case_code
table.remarks: Contains the list of case types supported by the system. For example HWCR = "Human Wildlife Conflict"

column.name: case_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a case type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case type.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: case_file
table.remarks: The central entity of the case management system.

column.name: case_file_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: case_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a case type.

column.name: owned_by_agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify the agency that owns this case.

column.name: inaction_reason_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: action_not_required_ind
column.remarks: True only if no action required was explicitly indicated for the case. It is assumed that action is required if not set.

column.name: note_text
column.remarks: A free-form note that can be edited by collaborators on the case.

column.name: review_required_ind
column.remarks: A flag to indicate that a further review of the file by a supervisor is required.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: case_file_h
table.remarks: History table for case_file table

column.name: h_case_file_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for case history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the case that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the case table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the case table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: configuration
table.remarks: The configuration table is used to store constants which are expected to change over the lifecycle of the application, or have different values in different environments. By making changes to in the database the behaviour of the application can be altered without requiring a full deployment.

column.name: configuration_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an configuration entry.

column.name: configuration_value
column.remarks: The value of the configuration entry.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the configuration entry.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the configuration_entry is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the configuration entry.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the configuration entry was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the configuration entry.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the configuration entry was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: configuration_h
table.remarks: History table for configuration table

column.name: h_configuration_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for configuration history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the configuration that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the configuration table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the configuration table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: conflict_history_code
table.remarks: A classification on the frequence that the target wildlife has previously had a history of human conflict. For example L = "Low"

column.name: conflict_history_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a conflict history type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a conflict history type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a conflict history type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the conflict history type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a conflict history type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the conflict history type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the conflict history type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the conflict history type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the conflict history type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: decision
table.remarks: As a CEEB Compliance Coordinator or Officer, I need to be able to capture decision information to ensure that all information necessary in the decision making process can be captured in the complaint.

column.name: decision_guid
column.remarks: Unique identifier for the decision

column.name: case_file_guid
column.remarks: Assoiciates the decision record to an existing case file

column.name: schedule_sector_xref_guid
column.remarks: Defines the combination of a WDR_SCHEDULE_CODE and a SECTOR_CATEGORY_CODE

column.name: discharge_code
column.remarks: The discharge code related to a decision

column.name: rationale_code
column.remarks: The rationale code related to a CEEB decision

column.name: inspection_number
column.remarks: The NRIS inspection number for a CEEB decision

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management action is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management action.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management action was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management action.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management action was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: discharge_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible discharge codes for a CEEB decision

column.name: discharge_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a discharge code.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management discharge_code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management discharge_code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management discharge_code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management discharge_code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management discharge_code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management discharge_code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management discharge_code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: drug_administered
table.remarks: While an officer is responding to a LEAD they may need to record that a WILDLIFE had a DRUG_ADMINISTERED. This table keeps track of the type and amount of drugs administered, along with what happened to any remaining drug that was not used.

column.name: drug_administered_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an drug that was administered to an animal. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: wildlife_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an animal. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: drug_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a drug type.

column.name: drug_method_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a drug injection method type.

column.name: drug_remaining_outcome_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: vial_number
column.remarks: A vial number that relates to a seperate drug inventory system.

column.name: drug_used_amount
column.remarks: The amount of drug used

column.name: drug_discarded_amount
column.remarks: The amount of drug that was discarded

column.name: discard_method_text
column.remarks: Brief narrative explaining how the drug was discared

column.name: adverse_reaction_text
column.remarks: Brief narrative documenting any adverse reactions observed

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the drug_administered record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug_administered record was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the drug_administered record.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug_administered record was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the drug_administered record is active.

table.name: drug_administered_h
table.remarks: History table for case_file table

column.name: h_drug_administered_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for case history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the case that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the case table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the case table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: drug_code
table.remarks: Contains the list of drugs that could be administered to wildlife. For example ATPMZ = "Atipamezole"

column.name: drug_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a drug type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a drug type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a drug type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the drug type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a drug type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the drug type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the drug type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: drug_method_code
table.remarks: Contains the list of drug induction methods types supported by the system. For example DART = "Dart"

column.name: drug_method_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a drug injection method type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a drug injection method type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a drug injection method type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the drug injection method type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a drug injection method type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the drug injection method type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug injection method type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the drug injection method type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the drug injection method type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: drug_remaining_outcome_code
table.remarks: After a drug has been induced to an animal, the fate of the remaining drug in the vial is recorded. This table contains a list of types supported by the system. For example DISC = "Discard"

column.name: drug_remaining_outcome_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the remaining drug outcome type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a remaining drug outcome type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the remaining drug outcome type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the remaining drug outcome type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the remaining drug outcome type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: ear_code
table.remarks: Indicates which ear an identification tag is present on. For example L = "Left"

column.name: ear_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an ear type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of an ear type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of an ear type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the ear type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if an ear type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the ear type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ear type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the ear type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ear type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: ear_tag
table.remarks: an EAR_TAG is used to identify a specific WILDLIFE allowing the animal to be tracked over time.

column.name: ear_tag_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an ear tag. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: wildlife_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an animal. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: ear_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an ear type.

column.name: ear_tag_identifier
column.remarks: An identifier used to label an animal, not used as a natural key as they are not guaranteed to be unique

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the ear_tag record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ear_tag record was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the ear_tag record.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ear_tag record was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the ear_tag record is active.

table.name: ear_tag_h
table.remarks: History table for case_file table

column.name: h_ear_tag_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for case history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the case that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the case table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the case table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: equipment
table.remarks: Represents a piece of physical equipment that has been deployed in support of the case. Contains information about where and when the equipment was deployed.

column.name: equipment_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a piece of equipment. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: equipment_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a piece of equipment

column.name: equipment_location_desc
column.remarks: Free form text describing the location of the equipment. Usually (but not always) an address.

column.name: equipment_geometry_point
column.remarks: The closest approximation to where the equipment is deployed. Stored as a geometric point using the EPSG:3005 Projected Coordinate System (BC Albers)

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the equipment record is active and should be displayed in the application.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the equipment record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the equipment record was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the equipment record.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the equipment record was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: was_animal_captured
column.remarks: Indicates if an animal was captured by the EQUIPMENT. Values are limited to 'Y' (Yes) 'N' (No) and 'U' (Unknown - Not Specified Yet). The default is 'U'

table.name: equipment_code
table.remarks: Used to track pieces of equipment that could be deployed out in the field. For example BRSNR = "Bear Snare"

column.name: equipment_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an equipment type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of an equipment type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of an equipment type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the equipment type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if an equipment type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the equipment type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the equipment type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the equipment type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the equipment type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: is_trap_ind
column.remarks: Indicates if the EQUIPMENT_CODE value represents a trap. Default to 'true'. For EQUIPMENT_CODE values such as Signage or Trail cameras the value is 'false'

table.name: hwcr_outcome_code
table.remarks: Indicates the final outcome for an animal as a result of an HWC. For example DESTRYCOS = "Destroyed by COS"

column.name: hwcr_outcome_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an HWCR outcome type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of an HWCR outcome type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of an HWCR outcome type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the HWCR outcome type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if an HWCR outcome type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the HWCR outcome type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR outcome type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the HWCR outcome type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR outcome type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: inaction_reason_code
table.remarks: Contains the list of available reasons a user can select to indicate that the reason why they did not take any action on a case. Values are Organization specific.

column.name: inaction_reason_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the reasons why no action on the case was taken should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the reason why no action on the case was taken is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the reason why no action on the case was taken was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the reason why no action on the case was taken.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the reason why no action on the case was taken was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: lead
table.remarks: A lead is any potential issue that an agency is made aware of. This could be a complaint, referral, etc. A lead needs to be evaluated to determine if it will become a case.

column.name: lead_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by an external system.

column.name: case_identifier
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint/case relationship.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint/case relationship was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint/case relationship.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint/case relationship was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: lead_h
table.remarks: History table for lead table

column.name: h_lead_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for lead history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the lead that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the lead table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the lead table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: non_compliance_decision_matrix_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible non_compliance_decision_matrix_code codes for a CEEB decision

column.name: non_compliance_decision_matrix_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a non_compliance_decision_matrix_code code.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management non_compliance_decision_matrix_code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: rationale_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible rationale_code codes for a CEEB decision

column.name: rationale_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a rationale code.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management rationale_code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management rationale_code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management rationale_code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management rationale_code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management rationale_code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management rationale_code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management rationale_code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: schedule_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible schedule_code codes for a CEEB decision

column.name: schedule_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a wdr schedule code

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management schedule_code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management schedule_code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management schedule_code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management schedule_code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management schedule_code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management schedule_code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management schedule_code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: sector_code
table.remarks: Contains a list of all possible sector_code codes for a CEEB decision

column.name: sector_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a ipm_secord_code

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a case management sector_code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a case management sector_code.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the case management sector_code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the case management sector_code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management sector_code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the case management sector_code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the case management sector_code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: sex_code
table.remarks: Contains the list of biological sexes supported by the system. For example M = "Male"

column.name: sex_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a sex type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a sex type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a sex type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the sex type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a sex type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the sex type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the sex type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the sex type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the sex type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: site
table.remarks: Contains the unauthorized site id for the Authroization Outcome

column.name: site_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a site record

column.name: case_file_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: The value used for an unauthorized site id

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the record has been soft deleted.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the unauthroized site id.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the unauthroized site id was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the unauthroized site id

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the unauthroized site id was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: site_h
table.remarks: History table for site table

column.name: h_site_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for site history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the site that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the site table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the site table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: threat_level_code
table.remarks: A COS determination that indicates the threat level of the animal to humans. For example 1 = "Category 1"

column.name: threat_level_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a threat level type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a threat level type.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a threat level type.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the threat level type should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if a threat level type is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the threat level type.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the threat level type was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the threat level type.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the threat level type was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: wildlife
table.remarks: WILDLIFE can be a participant on a CASE_FILE, specifically for CASE_FILE with a CASE_CODE of "HWCR" (Human / Wildlife Conflict)

column.name: wildlife_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an animal. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: case_file_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a case. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: threat_level_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a threat level type.

column.name: conflict_history_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a conflict history type.

column.name: sex_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a sex type.

column.name: age_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an age type.

column.name: hwcr_outcome_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an HWCR outcome type.

column.name: species_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a species. The COS Complaint Management is the authorative source for the screen labels and descriptions of the codes.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the wildlife record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the wildlife record was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the wildlife record.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the wildlife record was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the wildlife record is active.

table.name: wildlife_h
table.remarks: History table for case_file table

column.name: h_wildlife_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for case history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the case that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the case table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the case table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

routine.name: audit_history()
